jsonschema.description: The schema for the byotube service

joined.description: Date & time when the pod became a member of the service

schema_versions.description: All the versions of the schema supported by the pod

auto_upgrade.description: Should the pod automatically upgrade to the latest schema version available?

jsonschema.title: BYO Tube

network_link.description: links to other members who you have a social connection with, such as friend, colleague, family, etc.

created_timestamp.description: time the network link was created

member_id.description: The UUID of the other member

relation.description: What relation you have with the other member

annotations.description: annotations for the network link, for example if a ByoTuber has multiple channels then the specific channel that you want to follow

last_health_api_success.description: The last time the health API of the remote pod was successfully called

network_invite.description: An invite we received to network with another member

created_timestamp.description: time the network invite was created

member_id.description: The UUID of the other member

relation.description: The relation the other member claims to have with you

text.description: The text of the invitation provded by the other member

claims.description: list of claims for the asset

network_link_inbound.description: The relation another member has with you

created_timestamp.description: time the network relation was created

member_id.description: The UUID of the other member

relation.description: The relation the other member has with you

claims.description: list of claims for the asset

asset_reaction.description: Reactions received by the member to assets of the member

member_id.description: The UUID of the member that reacted to our asset

relation.description: What relation the other member has with our asset, for example liked

bookmark.description: Bookmark for the asset where to resume consumption of the asset, for example, seconds in a video or page in a book

annotations.description: annotations for the asset, things like 'genre:action' or 'city:San Francisco'

categories.description: categories for the asset, things like 'Education' or 'Comedy

list_name.description: The list that the member puts the asset in, for example, the list of assets about beekeeping

claims.description: list of claims for the reaction

message.description: A message sent to another member or a comment under a video

sender_id.description: The UUID of the member that sent the message

thread_id.description: The UUID of the thread that the message belongs to

in_response_to_id.description: The UUID of the message that this message is a response to

claims.description: list of claims for the message

restricted_content_key.description: keys used to manage access to restricted content

key.description: key used to create content tokens

not_before.description: time before which the key is not valid

not_after.description: time after which the key is not valid

datalog.description: log entries for the membership of the service

created_timestamp.description: time the log entry was created

remote_addr.description: The remote IP address performing the request

remote_id.description: The ID of the client originating the log entry

remote_id_type.description: The type of ID used to authenticate, ie. member, service or account

origin_member_id.description: The UUID of the member that originated the recurise query

origin_timestamp.description: The time the query was created by the origin member of the recursive query

query_id.description: Unique identifier for queries so pods can drop duplicate recursive queries

origin_signature.description: base64 encoded signature of a recursive query

signature_format_version.description: The version of the signature format used

operation.description: What operation that was requested by the client

object.description: name of the object in the Data API query

query_filters.description: the filters specified in the Data API query

query_depth.description: the depth specified the Data API query

query_relations.description: the relations specified in the Data API query

query_remote_member_id.description: The member that was specified in the append request to proxy to

source.description: The source of the log entry, ie. the client, a Data API query, etc.

chapter_id.description: The UUID of the video chapter

start.description: The start of the chapter, as an offset in seconds from the start of the video

end.description: The start of the chapter, as an offset in seconds from the start of the video

thumbnail_id.description: The UUID of the video thumbnail

size.description: a textual description of the resolution of the thumbnail, ie. '640x480' or '4k'

preference.description: The preference of the thumbnail, ie. 'default', 'high', 'medium', 'low'

youtube_url.description: The URL of the thumbnail on YouTube

display_hint.description: the type of display this thumbnail was created for

claim.description: A claim signed by a party.

claim_id.description: The UUID of the claim, unique to the signer of the claim

claims.description: The claims that are validated by the issuer

issuer_id.description: The UUID of the claim issuer

issuer_type.description: what type of entity issued this claim

object_type.description: The name of the array storing the object of the claim, ie. 'public_assets' and not 'asset'. The array must store objects that have a data property 'asset_id'

keyfield.description: name of the field used to identify the object, ie. 'asset_id'. The field must be of type 'UUID'

keyfield_id.description: The UUID of the keyfield of the claim

object_fields.description: The fields covered by the signature of the object with ID 'object_id' stored in the array 'object_type'

requester_id.description: The UUID of the entity that requested the claim to be signed by the issuer

requester_type.description: what type of entity requested this claim to be signed by the issuer

signature.description: base64-encoding signature for the values for the 'object_fields' of the object with uuid 'object_id' of type 'object_class'

signature_timestamp.description: Date & time for when the signature was created

signature_format_version.description: The version of the signature format used. Each version defines the hashing algorithm and how to format the data to be signed. The formats are defined in byoda-python/byoda/datamodel/claim.py

signature_url.description: URL to visit to get additional info about the signature

renewal_url.description: URL to request new signature of the asset

confirmation_url.description: URL of API to call to confirm the signature has not been revoked

cert_fingerprint.description: the SHA2-256 fingerprint of the certificate used to sign the claim

cert_expiration.description: the timestamp when the cert used to create the signature expires

asset.description: an asset like a tweet, a message, a video, etc.

created_timestamp.description: time the asset was added to the pod

asset_type.description: type of asset, ie. a tweet, a message, a video, etc.

asset_merkle_root_hash.description: the base64-encoded merkle root hash of the asset. The full hash tree can be downloaded by taking the asset_url and replace the filename in that url with 'merkle-tree.db'

video_thumbnails.description: list of thumbnails for the asset

video_chapters.description: list of video chapters for the asset

encoding_profiles.description: list of encoding profiles for the asset

locale.description: locale for the metadata, ie. en_US

published_timestamp.description: date-time of first publication of the content

content_warnings.description: list of terms with potential triggers, such as violence, or cursing

claims.description: list of claims for the asset

publisher_asset_id.description: Identifier of the asset set by the publisher

publisher_views.description: The number of views the asset has had on the publisher platform

publisher_likes.description: The number of likes the asset has had on the publisher platform

subject.description: a brief description of the asset

annotations.description: annotations for the asset, things like 'genre:action' or 'city:San Francisco'

categories.description: categories for the asset, things like 'Education' or 'Comedy

channel_id.description: UUID of the channel, if any, that the asset was posted to

screen_orientation_horizontal.description: Whether content is optimized for consumption on a screen with horizontal orietation

monetizations.description: list of monetizations required for the asset

burst_point_attestation.description: An attestation for the possession of a number of burst points at a point in time

member_id.description: The UUID of the member for which the attestation is claimed

member_type.description: The type of the member: member or BT.Lite

burst_points.description: The number of burst points claimed

claims.description: list of claims for the attestation

monetization.description: A monetization requirement for consuming an asset. If multiple requirements are listed, all of the requirements must be met

monetization_type.description: The type of the monetization, ie. burst-points, pay-per-view, subscription, etc.

require_burst_points.description: Does consumption of the asset require burst points to be transferred

network_relations.description: The asset owner must have one of the listed relations with the requesting member to provide a token to access the asset

payment_options.description: The payment options available to the member to access the asset

payment_option.description: An option to make a purchase

payment_option_id.description: The UUID of the payment option

amount_in_smallest_currency_unit.description: The amount for the payment option

currency.description: The currency of the payment option

accepted_payment_provider_ids.description: The UUIDs of the payment providers that are accepted for this payment option

financial_transaction_receipt.description: A receipt for a financial transaction

payer_id_type.description: The type of the payer, member / bt.lite account, service or app

payee_id_type.description: The type of the payee, member, service or app

description.description: The description of the transaction on the payer's statement

is_disputable.description: Whether the transaction can be disputed with the payment provider

immediate_confirmation.description: Whether the transaction has delayed confirmation of success

payment_provider.description: The UUIDname of the payment provider

payment_provider_id.description: The UUID of the payment provider

payment_provider_type.description: The type of identy of the paymet provider, normally APP-

payment_provider_support_email.description: The email address of the payment provider for support

payment_provider_url.description: The URL of the home page of the payment provider

payment_provider_dispute_url.description: The URL of the dispute resolution page of the payment provider for this transaction

payment_transaction_url.description: The URL to the website of the provider for the transaction

product_sku.description: The SKU of the product procured with this transaction

product_annotations.description: The annotation of the product procured with this transaction

transaction_asset_id.description: The UUID of the asset procured with this transaction

transaction_asset_class.description: The class of the asset procured with this transaction, ie. public_assets, network_assets

claims.description: list of claims for the asset

channel.description: a Tube channel, enabling creators to group videos under different channels

keywords.description: keywords that apply to all the videos of the channel

is_family_safe.description: Whether the channel is family safe

available_country_codes.description: list of country codes where the channel is available

thirdparty_platform_followers.description: The number of followers the channel has on other platforms

thirdparty_platform_videos.description: The number of videos the channel has on other platforms

thirdparty_platform_views.description: The number of views the channel has on other platforms

claims.description: list of claims for the asset

priority.description: priority of the link, informs in what order links should be presented
